B.title: Short-Answer Questions
B.instructions: Answer any 10 questions from this section. At least three question from each section.

questions.question: The centroid of triangle, whose two vertices are (2, 4) and (3, -4), is found to be (3, 1). Find its third vertex. OR In what ratio is the line segment joining (1, 3) and (2, 7) divided by 3x + y = 9?
Find the equation of the line which is perpendicular to 2x + 3y + 4 = 0 and passes through (2, -1).
A line, whose y-intercept is 1 less than its x-intercept, forms with the coordinate axis a triangle of area 6 square units. What is its equation?

A particle, acted upon by the forces 4i + j - 3k and 3i + j - k, is displaced from the point (1, 2, 3) to point (5, 4, 1). Find the work done. OR Calculate (a × b) for vectors a = 2i + 3j + 4k and b = i - j + k
Prove that: [a + b, b + c, c + a] = 2[a, b, c]
Find the equation of the circle of radius α which passes through the two points on the x-axis which are at a distance b from the origin
Find the equation of the parabola with focus (3,4) and directrix x + y - 1 = 0.
Find the equation of the ellipse whose centre is at (0,0), e = 2/3, latus rectum of length 20/3 and major axis is along y-axis.
Find the eccentricity, foci and directrices of hyperbola 9x² - y² + 1 = 0.

The length of the major axis of an ellipse is 25 units and its foci are the points (±5,0). Find its equation. OR Show that the eccentricities e₁ and e₂ of two conjugate hyperbolae satisfy the relation: e₁² + e₂² = e₁²e₂²
Find the derivative, by the first principle, at any point x = α in the domain D(f) of the function f(x) = cos²x OR f(x) = x^(2/3)
Evaluate any two of the following: (a) lim[x→0] (1 - cos x)/x² (b) lim[x→∞] (x² - 5x + 2)/(5x² + 6x - 4) (c) lim[x→0] (3e^x - e^(-x) - 2)/x
Find the approximate value of sin 46° using differentials.
Two polynomial functions f and g are defined by f(x) = x² - 3x + 4 and g(x) = x + 1, ∀ x ∈ R. Find fog, gof and show that fog ≠ gof. OR Find the limit of the sequence 3/2, 2/3, 5/4, 4/5, …
Solve the differential equation: 2 + 2y(dy/dx) = 1 + 3x², y(2) = 1

Evaluate any four of the following integrals: (i) ∫(x³ + 1)^(7/6) x⁵ dx (ii) ∫e^x (1 + sin x)/(1 + cos x) dx (iii) ∫[-6,-3] (x² - 9)/x dx (iv) ∫dx/(x² - x + 1) (v) ∫(7x - 25)/[(x - 3)(x - 4)] dx (vi) ∫(sec x tan x)/(a + b sec x) dx

parts.question: Find the centroid of the triangle the equation of whose sides are 12x² - 20xy + 7y² = 0 and 2x - 3y + 4 = 0.
The coordinates of two points A and B are (3,4) and (5,-2) respectively. Find the coordinates of any point P if |PA| = |PB| and the area of triangle PAB is 10 square units.
Three vertices A,B and C of a triangle are (2,1), (5,2) and (3,4) respectively. Find the coordinates of the circumcentre and the radius of the circumcircle of triangle ABC.

Evaluate dy/dx of any two of the following: (i) √(x² + y²) = ln(x² - y²) (ii) y = ln[(1 - x²)/(1 + x²)] (iii) x = a cos³θ, y = b sin³θ OR Find the relative maximum and minimum values of the function f(x) = e^x sin x
